intro: Coccoloba declinata var. vellozoana, commonly known as the Vellozoana coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline conditions. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage.
